ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: The class was a little fast paced. May be not having the two last guest lectures will benefit the course.
Good class to gain a surface-level knowledge of Python and C++. Too much materials is attempted to be covered in too short a period of time.

It can be a difficult class to keep up with at times, but it really does a good job of introducing you to C++, which is used quite a lot for scientific computing. What's a bit annoying is how sometimes, the problems are more physics than computing--which is to say that understanding the physics part is a lot harder than the computing you need to do. Which is understandable as it is a physics class, but I feel the computing should be more emphasized.

Great course - learned a lot about Python and C++ (and taking advantage of object-oriented languages in general). Mandatory class attendance was annoying though. Beware - the last couple of psets and final project more than make up for the simplicity of the first half of the course.
This class is a crash course in Python and C++. I would recommend it to any students wanting to become knowledgable from each language. It is not for students with no programming experience.
A challenging class that is rewarding if you have the time to commit to it

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: This class was outside of my major, and not really applicable to my research. However, in the future, I think I will need to use computing to help with my research, so it should be useful then.
I am now comfortable with Python, which will be useful for my research.
I did learn a lot, but again, if we learned a little less and spent more in depth time on the other parts I think this class could be really amazing.
